alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 4:45PM CDT until May 29 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Cameron. * WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olmito, Brownsville, Stillman Middle School, Villa Nueva Elementary School, San Pedro, Brownsville Sports Park, Driscoll Childrens Hospital, Pullam Elementary School, Olmito Lake, Keller Elementary, Ortiz Elementary School, Valley Regional Medical Center, Sunrise Mall, Brownsville Golf Center, La Encantada Elementary School, Northside Transfer Station, Resaca De La Palma Reservoir, Stillman Dog Park, Villa Cavazos and Windwood Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
